task_summary: The robot pours the contents of a cup into a mug placed on a table, using visual detection and sequential arm actions to ensure correct alignment and transfer.

task_long_description.overview: In this episode, a robot arm executes the sequential steps required to pour an object (liquid or granules) from a cup into a target mug positioned on a tabletop. The arm first visually confirms and detects the mug's location, approaches above it, then executes a tilting pour action to empty the source cup into the mug, and finally retreats to a safe position. The process leverages visual feedback and fixed kinematic routines, aiming to ensure accuracy and avoid spillage.
preconditions: Cup is held by the robot, containing pourable contents.
Mug is placed upright and in view on the table.
Workspace is clear; no obstructions between robot and mug.
stepwise_plan: Visually acquire and verify the mug's position.
Move the end-effector above the mug.
Execute a pour from the cup into the mug with controlled tilt.
Return the arm above the mug.
success_criteria: Majority of source contents are transferred into the mug.
No collision occurs with mug or workspace.
Robot completes all actions without fault.
failure_and_recovery: If mug is not detected, retry scan up to three times.
If pour does not occur due to kinematic error, abort and retreat.
If object is dropped, abort sequence.
task_long_description.termination: Task terminates when the robot retreats following pouring, regardless of success or interruption.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the target mug is visible to the robot sensors.
Scans for the mug using a raster pattern if not already visible.
Performs visual detection/localization of the mug.
Moves end-effector to a position above the mug.
Pours the contents of the cup into the mug with a 90 degree tilt.
Moves the tool away from the mug to a safe distance after pouring.

failure_modes: Mug not detected by perception subsystem.
Collision with mug or work surface.
Source cup not held at pour moment.
recovery_strategy: Retry scan for mug up to 3 times if not initially detected.
Abort and retreat on motion failure.
Abort if manipulation error or collision detected.
assumptions: Instruction does not specify source object; frames indicate cup as source, mug as target.
Pour amount and tilt deduced from frames; set to 'full' and 90Â° (max tilt) for typical pour.
No evidence of failed pours, spills, or need for retry after pour in frames.

expected_success_criteria: Cup successfully pours contents into mug.
